projects.name: Happiness Tracker
projects.description: Happiness tracking tool integrated with Islamic practices (muhasaba/muraja'a)
projects.approach: Random notifications for Experience Sampling Method (ESM), integration with Islamic self-reflection practices

sarec.reasoning: Project in early ideation, practical constraints being worked through

projects.name: Wellbeing Registry
projects.description: Resource registry for WHEN network using Values Experience (VX) framework
projects.design_philosophy: Springboard not platform - use once and leave, no social features
projects.methodology: VX design: Values cards → Affordances → UX → Architecture
projects.target_users: Campus wellbeing coordinators at higher education institutions

sarec.reasoning: Well-defined methodology, clear collaborator, comprehensive documentation created

organizations.name: WHEN
organizations.description: Coalition of higher education institutions committed to inner wellbeing in social change education
organizations.relevance: Target community for wellbeing registry pilot

organizations.name: The Wellbeing Project
organizations.role: Co-host of WHEN network, collaborator on registry

concepts.name: VX (Values Experience) Design
concepts.description: Design approach focused on enabling ways of being, not just features
concepts.distinction: Traditional UX: 'Make it easy to use' / VX: 'Enable ways of being'

concepts.name: CAPs (Constitutive Action Patterns)
concepts.description: Actions done for their own sake - reveals sources of meaning

concepts.name: IAPs (Instrumental Action Patterns)
concepts.description: Actions felt as obligations - reveals tensions

concepts.name: Muhasaba
concepts.description: Daily self-accounting/introspection, typically done at night

concepts.name: ESM (Experience Sampling Method)
concepts.description: Random interval sampling to avoid anticipation bias in measurement
concepts.application: Accurate happiness measurement through random check-ins

concepts.name: Springboard not Platform
concepts.description: Use once and leave (springboard) vs ongoing engagement (platform)
concepts.quote: You come there so you can spring off and do something else better

concepts.name: Affordances
concepts.description: System capabilities that enable (must do) or prevent (mustn't do) certain behaviors
concepts.in_vx_framework: Translation layer between values and UX

relationships.description: WHEN network is target pilot community

relationships.output: Values card: 'True Presence Beyond Medical Distance'
Values card: 'Opening to Be Changed by Others'
Values card: 'Questioning the 'Should' That Constrains Us'

caps_identified.description: Integrating technology with Islamic spiritual practices
manifestations: Designing happiness tracker with muhasaba/muraja'a integration
Connecting wellbeing measurement to Islamic self-reflection
attention_policies: INTEGRATION of modern tech with timeless wisdom

evidence.text: I want to make something like a happiness tracker that sends messages every so often randomly to accurately measure happiness - also maybe to connect it to muhasaba muraja3a

manifestations: Deep interview process to understand practitioner values
Translating values cards into affordances and UX
Rejecting features that conflict with core values (no social platform features)
attention_policies: WAYS OF BEING to enable, not just features to build
TENSIONS between values to name and resolve

evidence.name: vx_methodology_application
evidence.description: Comprehensive VX framework: interviews → values cards → affordances → UX → architecture

evidence.text: Ok, so now let's take all the content we have so far and attempt to do an values cards->affordances that would help them be they way they want to be -> ux all under the understanding of Aarons goals of the project

manifestations: Explicit rejection of social features, notifications, ongoing engagement

evidence.text: Springboard = climb up once, spring off, do work elsewhere (NOT a platform you live in)

manifestations: WhatsApp automation being difficult/expensive despite universal usage
Meta approval bureaucracy for WhatsApp Business API
related_tensions: Ideal user experience vs Technical/Cost feasibility

evidence.quote: Everyone wanting WhatsApp is actually a trap. Yes they check it, but Meta has made it nearly impossible to build automated tools on it

manifestations: Choosing between all 15 questions ($11-15) vs top 7 questions ($5-7) for extraction
Timeline compression (8 weeks ideal, 4 weeks minimum viable)

evidence.description: Created 'high priority questions' subset to reduce extraction costs by 50%

tensions_identified.title: Ideal UX vs Technical/Cost Constraints

quotes: Everyone wanting WhatsApp is actually a trap

attention_policies: ALTERNATIVES that balance usability and feasibility

tensions_identified.resolution_approach: Recommend SMS via Twilio as most reliable, PWA as free alternative

tensions_identified.title: Practitioner Co-Creation Value vs Aaron's No-Platform Boundary
tensions_identified.description: Yazmany's value of 'Opening to Be Changed by Others' (collaborative annotation/co-creation) conflicts with Aaron's explicit 'NOT a social network' constraint

from.cap_2: Aaron's springboard philosophy (use once and leave)

to.resolution: Named tension in documentation - not every practitioner value becomes a platform feature. The registry shows WHO practices co-creation, but doesn't require the platform itself to be co-creative
to.design_implication: Practitioner profiles can indicate 'I co-create with communities' to help orgs find that approach, without building collaborative features into the registry
